meanings.definition: A position or place, especially in a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: In the game, each player has a specific possie to stand in.
meanings.sent2: The team captain assigned everyone a possie on the field.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, finding the best possie to sit in became a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She secured the top possie in the company, leading all her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The possie at the front of the line had the best view of the stage.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The possie of friends gathered at the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The possie of books on the shelf needed rearranging.
meanings.sent3: The possie of ducks waddled together in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The possie of stars in the sky twinkled brightly at night.
meanings.sent5: The possie of flowers in the garden added a burst of color.

meanings.definition: To take a position or place.
meanings.sent1: She decided to possie herself at the front of the line.
meanings.sent2: The students quickly possied up for the group photo.
meanings.sent3: He tried to possie himself strategically during the game.
meanings.sent4: The birds possied on the branches, chirping happily.
meanings.sent5: The cat possied itself on the windowsill, watching the world outside.
